text: Leptanilla swani is a species of ant in the genus Leptanilla. Described by William Morton Wheeler in 1932, the species is endemic to Australia, and the only species of the genus Leptanilla to be found there. Workers are pale in colour, measuring while queens are larger at long. ==References== ==External links== * Category:Leptanillinae Category:Hymenoptera of Australia Category:Insects described in 1932
title: Leptanilla swani
